title: FACT CHECK: This Modi lookalike is neither PM's brother nor are his photos digitally manipulated - Times of India

author: timesofindia.indiatimes.com
vclaim:
To put all the false claims to rest, Times Fact Check traced the man in question.

The photo of an auto-rickshaw driver with uncanny resemblance to Prime Minister Narendra Modi is being shared widely on social media with a claim that he is Modi’s younger brother.Many individual Facebook users and pages are sharing the photo with a caption in Hindi that closely translates to, “Salutes to the man who is the prime minister of the country but his younger brother is still an auto-rickshaw driver”.The post above has been shared more than 1,100 times and got over 5,100 reactions.A search on Facebook search bar using the caption in Hindi will lead you to many users and pages sharing the same image with the same claim.The photo of this auto-rickshaw driver went viral for the first time in 2016 with the same claim.Many social media users, since then, have also been claiming that the photo is digitally manipulated.The man is neither related to Modi nor are his photos digitally manipulated.The man who looks like Modi has been identified as Ayub. He hails from Telangana ’s Adilabad district.Ayub was appointed as a contract driver with the Andhra Pradesh State Road Transport Corporation (APSRTC) in 1998 but after a few years, he lost his job. Then, Ayub worked as a lorry driver and also as an auto-rickshaw driver. In 2014, he got a permanent job with the Telangana State Road Transport Corporation (TSRTC) as a driver and operates from the Adilabad bus depot.In June 2016, Navbharat Times did a story with a headline that loosely translates to, "Modi's brother makes a living by riding an autorickshaw?" and debunked the false claim that the man in the photo is Modi's younger brother.Ayub told Times Fact Check that people, seeing his resemblance to Modi, often take pictures with him and share it on social media. He said that when he travels to nearby states, people take selfies with him and that he was initially scared about getting such attention.Ayub, however, admitted that he has become used to it now.Here are some exclusive photos of Ayub. The man, indeed, is a Modi lookalike.Times Fact Check traced the auto-rickshaw driver whose photo is being shared widely with a false claim that he is Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s younger brother.We have found that he is neither related to Modi, nor are his photos digitally manipulated.
